p:
Patients will be followed at 3 monthly intervals. At each visit, the investigator will assess the patient for the following:
ECOG Performance status.
Tumour Evaluation:
◦ CT Chest, Abdomen and Pelvis OR FDG PET/CT (Investigator to keep imaging consistent for each patient).
◦ For patients who have had a bone scan showing progressive disease without CT changes, FDG PET/CT is recommended to confirm progression.
◦ High contrast CT or MRI brain (if clinically indicated).
◦ MRI spine (if clinically indicated).
Treatment related toxicity assessment as per NCI CTCAE v5.0
